title: Can you participate in NaNoWriMo with no preparation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely! I just convincced someone to join last minute. All you need for Nano is a place to write, and generally by the first week a story line is kinda nice to have in mind. But NaNo's made to be messy, made to be fun. Blurt out. 50000 words, then future you can mould it into a story. Go for it. Each word you write is one more than you had at the start! (Also for non-writers, or people who already have a first draft. There are comic, editing and screenwriting options as well. I can't remember the conversion rate off the top of my head, but its on the website). Goodluck!

You can, but I don’t advise it. You’ll face all kinds of decisions you won’t be prepared to make - you’ll unfortunately think of it as writers’ block - and you’ll stall, get frustrated and probably give up. I do all of my research in advance (September and October) so I have a basis for the novel. I usually start with a rough chapter outline that I end up abandoning at chapter four because my characters tell me which way the story should go, not the way I planned. But that’s better.

Personally this is the most enjoyable way, at least for me ,to participate. Having completed NaNoWriMo with both planning and “pants-ing” I find that no planning forces me to just write. When I have a plan everything hinges on getting to the next part in my outline. You can also take a hybrid approach and use the first day as your planning day. No matter what, START WRITING! Good Luck making words dance.

Yep! The point of NaNoWrioMo isn’t to plan a detailed story and write a masterpiece. It’s just to finish a draft, however crappy and flawed it might be. Planning is allowed, but it is not a requirement.

Did you go to their website and read about what is expected? That is a lot of words without thinking about it and here it is November 1st, but what do you have to lose? Give it a shot but you better get to writing. LOL National Novel Writing Month
